content.description: Starts just left of Synesthesia and Cardiac Corner. Climb techy face past 4 bolts to an awkward entry move into the obvious crack, which gets smaller and more splitter as one gets higher. Save a small cam for the finish.
content.location: Located on the right side of The Outpatient Clinic.Chain Anchor.

climbs.name: Synethesia  AKA Linger Fickin Good!
climbs.fa: FA Mark Hawthorne/ Mark GeikenJoyner, FFA Rodney Blakemore

content.description: 90ft of mostly finger jamming. the off-width at the top is "pleasantly easier"
content.protection: Quadruple set of TCU's, nuts useful too, plus Double set to #3.5Camalot, Rap from a bolt and fixed piece below the big roof.
content.location: Located in the approach drainage to Book of Friends. Continue up til just before it becomes a slot canyon. then look for the South facing "S" shaped finger splitter.

content.description: Gritstone bouldery start to awkward leaning corner, then great black crimps and knobs.
content.location: Left of Cardiac Corner. Rounded start to black face to chains.

content.description: This route is bound to become a doctor's office classic. Start up vertical face on awesome side pulls to second bolt. Moving from right hand jug until standing on low angle slab is crux one.  Get a no hands rest on low angle slab. Move up over the bulge, follow the rail up till the obvious horns are above (crux 2). Climb up the horns and up the remaining face to anchors.
content.location: The route is the second route right of night nurse. Begins on the right side of cool face, left of the crack.

content.description:
A large horizontal squeeze roof, requiring a parlor trick to get established in.  (Similar to Lucille in Vedauwoo) Either walk around the back and belay from inside the cave, or do the direct start (adding 30' of 9+ or so).  Chain anchor up top.

 Originally graded "5.hard!!!", so I put 5.11 as a guess.  (think scarpelli, not ....)
content.protection: A few small pieces up to a number 1 camalot and a 7 makes it pretty safe.  Add a couple more if your doing the direct start.
content.location: Pretty much right at the start of the slot canyon on your left.  Hard to miss.  Just left of "Excited Delerium".

content.description: Balancey, bearhuggy, gritstonesque climbing with two bolts gets you to a great rest ledge. Charge your batteries and launch into overhanging flared hands in a tight leaning right facing corner. The business is difficult flared fingers and body scumming over a bulge. Mantle over to another great rest. Finish with a fun, strenuous stembox with two bolts.
content.location: First wall on the left in The Outpatient Clinic. Look for the steep twin splitters looming above.

content.description: Climb up low fifth class to big left hand sidepull to get first clip. Move straight up on slanting holds until just below the second bolt. Make clip, then climb up using spectacular holds for both left and right hands until standing on the low angle slab (crux). Once standing, move right to finish on nasal reflux.
content.location: It is located in the out patient clinic. First route to the right of night nurse left of nasal reflux.

content.description: Located in the steep gully left and up from the "Outpatient Clinic."  Technique oriented sport route on the right wall of the guuly. Bring your guns and shoes for the start and your head for the slightly sporty finish.
A collection of harder routes are scattered on both the north and south sides of the canyon with a couple of easier lines.
